result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demon O'Neal Coleman Jr.

records.addlTxt: Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court sets bail at $5,000 cash

JusticePoint supervision to be reinstated at previously imposed level 3

Defendant Demon O'Neal Coleman Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Demon O'Neal Coleman Jr.  Attorney Jack Eichorst appearing for Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen, in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Parties in court for return of warrant.
Court reviews the history of the case and missed court appearance.
Court will address bail.

Court orders case adjourned for status in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
Return on warrant scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Demon O'Neal Coleman Jr. not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Demon O'Neal Coleman Jr.  Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case could not be heard on today's date.
Network connection in the courtroom was unavailable and no spin court was available.
Case is adjourned for return of warrant in Branch 28 on October 31, 2022.

Clerk:  jms
Return on warrant scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant has been picked up on warrant.
Parties notified via electronic mail by deputy clerk.
Parties unable to appear in court until October 28, 2022.
Case is adjourned for return of warrant in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
JusticePoint Discharge Report dated September 16, 2022 - received
JusticePoint Violation Report dated September 15, 2022 - received
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Demon O'Neal Coleman Jr. not in court.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia did not appear as he is in trial in another court on an unrelated case.  Attorney Kenneth Olstinski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant failed to appear in court on September 6, 2022.  Case was adjourned for calendar call on today's date.
Further, defendant failed to appear in court on today's date.

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  No bail forfeited at this time.

Clerk:  jms

Court received a telephone call from JusticePoint during the morning of September 7, 2022 indicating that they spoke with defendant, his hearing is later this week and he informed them he can only appear via Zoom video.
Deputy clerk advised JusticePoint that there is not a hearing later this week, hearing is scheduled at 1:30 p.m. on today's date.  Further, Court does not hold Zoom hearings.  Defendant is to appear in person or a bench warrant may be issued.

Clerk:  jms
Calendar call scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Demon O'Neal Coleman Jr. not in court.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia did not appear as he was in trial in another court on an unrelated case.  Attorney Kenneth Olstinski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant failing to appear, case is adjourned for calendar call in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Demon O'Neal Coleman in court, appear by video with attorney Michael J Cerniglia, appear by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28. Court remind defendant of active No Contact Order and conditions of Justice Point.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

PRELIMINARY HEARING
QUESTIONNAIRE & WAIVER
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated July 28, 2022- received
JusticePoint Status Report dated June 30, 2022 - received

Defendant Demon O'Neal Coleman in court, appear by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared appear by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Attorney Cerniglia was not present. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Court advised defendant to continue contact with Justice Point.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report  Received and Filed.

Defendant Demon O'Neal Coleman in court, appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness persent. Attorney Michael Cerniglia to be appointed pending conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Court ordered no contact with TNH, TMT.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Demon O'Neal Coleman in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Demon O'Neal Coleman in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
